item.title: 295 – Some Trick
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Some Trick 293 – Some Trick it’s some trick dismantling a body w/out hands nor body but old Renee was game to try grinding down the grain to meet the grain left at the center one thing to circle as … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Some Trick

293 – Some Trick

it’s some trick

dismantling a body

w/out hands nor body

but old Renee was game to try

grinding down the grain

to meet the grain

left at the center

one thing to circle

as the house fly here — material

though not quite — circling

my knee to alight and buzz off

in an instant, over and over

finding something central; or not

to hear Descartes tell it

my parts sum nothing

more than deception

my parts? these

lovely hands, these knees

and the body they’re about

are nevermore mine

than when reaching out

to some other body, some sum,

one being slowly slowly

becoming

item.title: 294 – Say Yes Quickly
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Say Yes Quickly Say yes quickly to your heart in another’s hands Say yes to your shadow peeled from the wall commence to eating Say yes to your body made, unmade in the mirror Say yes quickly before you say nothing
item.content:encoded:
Say Yes Quickly

Say yes quickly
to your heart
in another’s hands

Say yes to your shadow
peeled from the wall
commence to eating

Say yes to your body
made, unmade
in the mirror

Say yes quickly
before you say
nothing

item.title: 293 – what can man, will
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: what can man, will who what man were where can walk wrack bent what man broken bent can walk stand alone rest wrest what man can wrestle can man what can man break hold all       hell broke … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
what can man, will

who what man were where
can walk wrack bent
what man broken bent
can walk stand alone rest
wrest what man can
wrestle can man what can
man break hold all       hell broke
loose bone break broken
what man can man can what
finger fist grip made broken
wrist gripped held breaking broke
drug dirt down what can man want
wait can man want what can
man demand can call can yell    blessing
demand can man broken give
up can give cannot give up
can man will will not man can
give up can will not will
not give up

item.title: 292 – Sea
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Sea knees moor one behind the other breath swells and troughs a deep blue dreams roll silently on the sea of sleep
item.content:encoded:
Sea

knees moor
one behind
the other

breath swells
and troughs
a deep blue

dreams roll
silently
on the sea

of sleep

item.title: 291 – Poseidon
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Poseidon Man, the man you are appears as out of sea fog when you shave down the burly anemone of a fuck-off beard you wear around like a threat. When did you claim the tarnished crown? Washed up on shore among the sleeping battleships you … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Poseidon

Man, the man you are
appears as out of sea fog
when you shave down
the burly anemone
of a fuck-off beard you wear
around like a threat.
When did you claim
the tarnished crown?

Washed up on shore
among the sleeping
battleships you wandered,
glinting hard.  A sound
fathoms deeper than
the growling tide saying
take what was always yours. 

Mermaid kiss. Bullion.
Salt sting. Trident.
Your own face
hovering covered
in old wire, creeping
rust, barnacles
and seaweed.
Come clean.
Be thee.

item.title: 290 – MOG
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: MOG I’m w/you John Candy– half-man half-dog tonight I’m my own best friend
item.content:encoded:
MOG

I’m w/you
John Candy–
half-man
half-dog
tonight
I’m my own
best friend

item.title: 289 – After Prints and Drawings of Käthe Kollwitz
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: After Prints and Drawings of Käthe Kollwitz She meant for them to be seen in low light. I tip the votive too far, encasing my fingers in wax, sealing in the sob silent before me on the page, ghosts hovering in this … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
After Prints and Drawings of Käthe Kollwitz

She meant for them to be seen
in low light. I tip the votive
too far, encasing my fingers
in wax, sealing in the sob
silent before me on the page,
ghosts hovering in this dark corner.
Up front the honey pools
from a jazz trio, their jitney
filling in her razored lines
achingly placed. The twisted mouth
of a widow. The laborer’s raised fist.
Only instruments: bricks and stones
and singing scythes. The tenor
sax, the bass and drums plumb
the depths. Another whiskey, please.
Another round to sit and stew,
all those sharp lines converging
somewhere inside.

item.title: 288 – Giza [fragment]
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Giza [fragment] precious precarious oranges plucked pyramid of citrus stacked serpent -spirit snaked center of sweetness
item.content:encoded:
Giza [fragment]

precious
precarious
oranges
plucked
pyramid
of citrus
stacked
serpent
-spirit
snaked
center
of sweetness

item.title: 287 – The Keeper Among His Hives
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: The Keeper Among His Hives Restless after dream, out early at the wet edge of dawn, in the clover and alfalfa, the Keeper casts aside the whitened heavy wooden lids trembling with an ever-growl, hidden not by smoke or veiling suit of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
The Keeper Among His Hives

Restless after dream, out early
at the wet edge of dawn, in the clover
and alfalfa, the Keeper casts aside
the whitened heavy wooden lids trembling
with an ever-growl, hidden not
by smoke or veiling suit
of white, to stand centered
in the murmuring swarm
of drones and workers, swallowed
by the skin-prick of feet
and a million tiny mouths
knowing him, his own mouth open
to admit of love and holy fear,
tasting sweetness and the sting.

item.title: 286 – Apophatic Confession
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Apophatic Confession I am as certain of the Divine as I am of the green bottle before me, empty of wine, full of the shape of emptiness
item.content:encoded:
Apophatic Confession

I am as certain
of the Divine
as I am
of the green bottle
before me, empty
of wine, full
of the shape
of emptiness
